credentials: PHD 2002 Univ Of NC At Chapel Hill
name: JEFFREY BENEKER

ratings.comment: Professor Beneker gave awesome interactive lectures! He had a severe personal issue arise during the semester and did his best to support his class and get sub-professors for the class. I really appreciated his efforts and sincerity in this, plus his exams were straight forward and he gave a lot of support in through assignments/groupwork.

Fun and engaging lectures even if you're not the biggest fan of Ancient history. Comm-B class so definitely a lot of reading and writing. The honors discussions were fun and had a lot of activities that taught us things in an implicit way (expert level teaching). Professor is understanding (but principled) and accessible. Highly recommend

Really intriguing class if you're interested in The Greeks. Must attend class because lectures are not posted on Canvas. Other than that, he's actually very understanding/accommodating, e.g. will give extensions if needed. The weekly responses actually improved my writing, even though I'd already fulfilled my Comm B req. Participate in discussion.

Professor Beneker is an amazing and passionate lecturer. I've never imagined myself to like learning history but he made it so interesting to listen. There's 3 exams open notes, weekly responses 600 words to the materials, and a research paper. Take it if you are interested in the Greeks!

Great professor. Lectures are mandatory because they are not uploaded anywhere on Canvas, but its only twice a week, so not really a problem. The class material is very interesting and we read from many different sources. Writing weekly essays is a big part of this class, but the TAs are super friendly and helpful.

I loved this class! I had no prior knowledge of Greek myth before this, and you don't need it. Lectures were all engaging, but he doesn't post them online so attendance is necessary. He will also stress certain points that always show up on exams, so take detailed notes. Each week we would read about 200-300 pages, but they can be skimmed.

I liked Dr. Beneker and thought he was really nice, but the class was a bit more dense than I expected.  I can tell he wants his students to succeed, but he will make you work for it.  You HAVE to go to class or you'll miss all the info he tests/quizzes you on.  As long as you show up to class and pay attention, you'll know everything you need to.
Very wholesome guy. An awesome class that I find myself missing. Take it if you have the chance!
11/10 would take again

Professor Beneker was a great professor. He made sure to tell history more in a storytelling type of way rather than spitting out facts and timelines. It was digestible, work heavy, but easy to get an A so long as you do the work. Agreed, a lot of writing in this course, but that has to do with Com B requirements and was definitely doable.

Jeff is truly one of the best guys on this campus. So kind, caring, interesting, respectful, and flexible. I took his course that he helps develop (the Chadbourne residential learning community) and I could not recommend him more. It was awesome to take a class with him and I hope I have another chance in my tenure here.

Beneker rules, he's very engaging in lecture and knows how to present Greek history in a way that's understandable and interesting even to those who don't know much about it. He's very accessible and easy to talk to outside of class. Despite it being a huge lecture I do feel he genuinely wants each student to learn and succeed.

Professor Beneker is a great lecturer, which is good because classics 320 was very lecture-heavy. He organized the discussions to be review-based activities and mandatory attendance. I walked into this class knowing nothing about classics and walked out feeling inspired and interested! He is always willing to help and the workload wasn't too heavy.

One of my favorite professors. Class has lots of reading but the assignments are not difficult. Quizzes are fair and not too intense. Lectures are fantastic and hold all the material needed to do well on the quizzes and short writing assignments/reflections. Really knowledgable professor with great presenting skills and enthusiasm

Professor Beneker is definitely passionate and knowledgable about Greek culture and literature. This class was a lot of writing, but I never felt overwhelmed (weekly 500 word responses and one final research essay). There are two readings each week but they were usually interesting and the quizzes were easy and straightforward.
Beneker was a great professor! Interesting class and lectures, super accommodating with the pandemic as well. Would recommend.

Took the class online, but could tell he's a great professor. Very knowledgable and the course expectations and material are organized well. Weekly quizzes that you can take while watching the lecture video. Don't really need to do all the reading to get a good grade. Final project less imposing than it sounds and totally manageable workload.

I love mythology so I loved the content of the lectures. Professor was lively, fun, knowledgable and engaging. Classwork is totally manageable, must study for tests but it is basically memorization. If you like mythology you will absolutely like the class, although if you can't stand Greek epics/ plays don't take it.
Adapted well to the online format.

The grading in this class is so subjective that even with the rubric I still never knew how well I was going to do on an assignment. Asked my TA for help and he said everything is really straightforward from the lectures. spoiler.. it wast

Prof. Beneker is a gem at UW-Madison. He was my discussion leader (honors section) and he was just super funny, caring, and low key. He grades papers easily. Tests/quizzes are REALLY straightforward and short. He split my class exams into four sections so no part was larger than the other, which was a lot less stressful than other exams. Loved him.
Jefferey makes the lectures more digestible. The class itself is relatively boring, but Jeffrey adds a little bit of dry-humor into the mix to spice it up.

Beneker is an awesome professor! He knows a lot of interesting things about Classics and makes the lectures really enjoyable with his examples and jokes! He posts slides online but it's worth it to show up to lecture. Definitely need to read and know details about the characters in the books to do well in the class. Honors section is really fun!

Very manageable course. Weekly canvas questions/discussions that follow from the lectures. Provides study guides for the midterm+final which is great. Pretty boring lectures though(it is a classics course afterall) but he does try to make some jokes. Would recommend for fulfilling gen ed requirements.
Perfect professor with a great attitude. He knew what he was doing all the time and he was always enthusiastic to teach.

I came into Greek without any previous experience. I loved Prof. Beneker's class. Beneker managed to make the material engaging and related the course through humor and his enthusiasm. Definitely recommend!

The lectures cover a lot of material and moves fast, and it is not always clear what will be tested. A lot of reading is required, but most of the stories are interesting. Every lecture includes one slide that is not posted online, so attendance is mandatory. The exams were pretty straightforward and not too difficult, and discussions were fun.

I really liked having Beneker as a professor. Gives very clear expectations and lets you know exactly what you need to do to get an A. Very organized, and presents the material in an interesting and relatable fashion

I cycled through many majors at my time at Madison, and experienced all types of teachers. Beneker was hands down the best. Not even close. I'm writing this four years out of school because he deserves it. Brilliant, kind, understanding. I was willing to learn Greek solely because I didn't want to let this man down. The school is lucky to have him.

Great professor, the readings assigned were all interesting in my opinion, and the lectures were great and all worth attending. Highly recommend you take CLA370 if you have an interest in Greek mythology, overall it was a very well organized and taught class.

AWESOME PROF. So passionate about what he teaches, and it shows in his lectures. He knows a ton about classical mythology and conveys it to the class really well. Lectures were laid-back and informative. All of the TA's offered cool ideas and topics of discussion. Not a ton of work, just reading, 2 papers and 2 tests. Would totally recommend 370
The best professor I've ever had. He was definitely the highlight of the semester!

Prof Beneker is very relaxed, and clearly knows his stuff. If you pay attention, he says some pretty funny things. Your grade is based off of a midterm, final, and two 1000 word papers, so keep up with your readings and you'll be fine. The hardest part is keeping your essay to only be 1000 words. Great guy overall!

This was for sure my favorite class this semester. Prof was super nice and had his funny moments, lectures were always interesting and he obviously knows a lot and is passionate about mythology. Tests were really easy and papers were manageable (two with 1000 words). I'm taking another classics class next semester just because I loved this one

An amazing professor. He made Classics 370 my favorite of the semester and you can really tell he has a passion for Greek culture and literature. I was really worried at the beginning about the amount of work but it ended up being completely manageable (1 midterm, 2 papers). One of the most interesting (and easy!) classes I've taken.
Good professor with entertaining lectures. Do the readings and pay attention and you should be fine. There are 2 exams (midterm & final) and 2 1000-word papers and they're all manageable.
Exams and papers are all about citing your readings, so if you read and mark important quotes as you do the readings, you'll be just fine.  Attendance is required, but he makes it worthwhile.

His expertise in mythology is clearly evident. His sense of humor sometimes shines through, which makes lectures fun to attend. Other than that, his course was well-structured and, I believe, has many insights to offer the student interested in human nature.

Prof. Beneker was awesome! Going to lecture was not a chore and Beneker makes things interesting. The material was easy to comprehend. No homework, just 2 papers and 2 exams. Just don't get behind in the readings and you'll be fine.

Very interesting and sometimes funny lectures, and most of the myths are interesting too. The papers for this class have prompts that are difficult to cover in only 1000 words (the max. +/- 50) which left me with an AB in the class when an A should be easily attainable. Still Beneker is a great prof. and you should definitely take him!

Looking at these ratings, he must be a better teacher in the Classics culture courses than language.  I did not find his teaching style very effective at all, at least for 2nd semester Greek. Lots of memorization of verb and noun forms with very little translation - I haven't taken much of anything away from this course.

Professor Beneker is the best teacher I've had here. His lectures are interesting and funny. The readings are interesting and the tests are very reasonable. Definitely will be taking other classes he teaches in the future. Take this class!

Perfect professor. As long as you do the readings, you'll do great. He partly talks about what we read, and partly gives background which is all useful. Class is 2 exams, 2 papers, and 20% participation in discussions. Great class. Take it. You'll enjoy the readings.

Professor Beneker was a really good lecturer.  The class is difficult, especially if you don't read the books.  He kind of repeats the books over in lecture, but if you miss attending those you won't do well.  He gives a lot of background to the plays you read, and those are pretty essential.  Otherwise, a slightly boring lecture.

Professor Beneker knows what he is talking about. The Readings are pretty short weekly, and he says everything in lecture that you need to know for the exams. My TA as really terrible, and gave pop quizes, so avoid Kerry Lefebvre if possible. Easy Multiple choice midterm and exam. The COMB meant a lot of papers, but all of them were short.

Prof. Beneker is awesome. Most of the test materials come from lecture notes, but it still helps to read the texts. Generally an easy course, but for tests he will throw some difficult questions on there (not many, but a few). Very easy course and I'd recommend it to anyone needing to fill a literature requirement.
It can be an easy class if you do the readings on time, but the lectures are mostly boring

Beneker is a good teacher.  As long as you read the books the class is pretty easy.  Its just two essays and two tests.  Lectures are not that bad and they are posted on-line.  TA's are helpful with the paper if you need it.

I really like Beneker. He talks really fast and goes through a lot of slides in class, but it's just one big story. He's a pretty funny guy and easy to listen to. Two exams, two papers: overall, pretty decent. As long as Greek mythology interests you, you'll enjoy it.
I really recommend this class, its an easy A and Beneker makes the lectures interesting. There are a few papers but the tests are easy and really fair.
Great Prof, fun and interesting to listen to.  Com B, so lots of reading and writing, but still very interesting.

Even though Ancient Greek is extremely difficult, Beneker tries to make it interesting and  less painful.  Tests are fair and he is more than willing to meet outside of class.  Great guy and wants to see students excel.
a very good class! Prof beneker is a very helpful and encouraging professor. exams were reasonable
this was one of the easiest classes i've taken so far. multiple choice exams, only two of them, and two papers to write. keep up with the reading and it's an easy A.
